WRITING.TITLE: In my lifetime, I was the first person to be born and will be the last person to die.

WRITING.TEXT: Fuck yeah, Ollie.
ROY SAID THE THING!
SIN.
I miss Thea and Roy together :(
Roy has the worst secret identity ever.
I wasn't fast enough getting home, so I can't watch it until tomorrow :(
That made me giggle. Thank you. I just felt like an upvote wasn't enough.

As a student, our class didn't find out that my anatomy teacher's wife had miscarried mid-semester until the end of the year. After he taught us about the reproductive system. He seemed to struggle during that unit, but we had no idea why.
I didn't know I needed this in my life, but I do.

I had only seen [this clip](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uEeBXUUOBiI) before watching the movie. I had no idea Tadashi was going to die and I didn't see it coming at all.
I bawled my eyes out. It was definitely the most dramatic part of the movie.

Damn, Lance looks intense.
While I love Laurel's look as the Black Canary, I just miss that blue jacket from the comic books/JLU.
Aw, that sucks. Sorry :(

I thought that Oliver's hair doesn't get cut until we see him in the hospital in the pilot. Right before he gets rescued by that boat, he's seen with long unruly hair and beard. I don't think flashback Oliver is going to have short hair.
His jumps reminded me of when Oliver was jumping around in the pilot.
Dude! You're a genius!
FUCK YEAH. LAUREL.
I wanted her to slap him so bad.

So Thea can figure out that Roy is Arsenal, but she can't figure out that her own brother is the Arrow?
Hmm.

*Black* Arrow?

*Green* Driver?
"I didn't say anything."

Daaaaaaaamn.

WRITING.TITLE: What is the best type of pet?
WRITING.TEXT: Ninja edit: And why?

Asylum. When I was 14. It might be the most cheesiest and cliche horror movie I've seen. I'm talking fake blood and brains and an obvious plot. But I had to have my friends pause it at the chase scene because I was freaking out. My heart was pounding like crazy and I was hyperventilating. Now I can't watch scary movies without a knitted blanket over me.
Season 7 was nothing but dick jokes.

I'm not sure it's either. I don't have Chromecast, but I've been using Hola for a year now. Reddit has just started saying I'm a bot when I press the back button. It seems like it's only coming up on Chrome based on the comments.

I was opening a can of green beans, but the can opener wasn't that great. The top of the can was only held together by two thin pieces of metal on opposite sides. I grab a fork and try to pry it open. I slash my palm open and there was blood everywhere. It left a nice scar though.
Cutting.
It took me way too long to realize why pouring tea through a strainer was a bad idea.
I wanted to get rid of the excess liquid wax from my lit candle, so I poured it down my bathroom sink. I forgot that the wax would harden.
If you don't like cold leftover pizza, you're wrong and I'm sorry for your poor taste in leftovers.
You're kitten me, right?
I'm learning to like Laurel again, but that made me chuckle.
That I've relapsed in my eating disorder recovery. I want to get better, but I want to lose weight more.
I'm vindictive. If you hurt me, I'll hurt you back. It's actually gotten me in serious trouble before.
Damn straight. Thailand mojito's are the shit.

You got me. I time traveled 3 years into the future and found out that I'm living with my parents again (the horror!) and then became a mute around my father after he shaved off all of his facial hair. It's like you read my diary or something...
I reportedly didn't speak to my dad for a month after he shaved off his mustache and beard. I would just stare at him and say nothing because I didn't recognize him.
Someone just told me to wake the fuck up, motherfucker. Seems legit.
I just found out my ex-boyfriend is gay by Googling him.
Since I was 6 I have been able to say "Docious-ali-expi-istic-fragil-cali-rupus". It's my go-to fun fact.

I nanny'd for two kids during the summer, and was constantly trying to find activities to do with them. I decided that we would paint pictures for the parents. On a small tube of paint, one of the lids would not come off, so I put pressure on the tube. It burst open and splattered on their kitchen wall and myself. I tried to clean it up, but it had started to stain the wall. I get the brilliant idea to use a Magic Clean Eraser to wipe the paint off, but it ends up lightening patches of the wall. So to make sure the parents wouldn't find out what happened, I used 3 Magic Clean Erasers to lighten the entire wall.
Have you been there before? When I went I absolutely loved that museum. My friends and I had a blast. They have such interesting paintings.
